Address.Street: 80 Castle Peak Road, Castle Peak Bay
Address.college_name: Chu Hai College of Higher Education

GeneralInformation.History: Chu Hai University was founded in Guangzhou, China 1947. The University moved to Hong Kong and registered as Chu Hai College 1949. Acquired present status 1949.
Founded 1984 as City Polytechnic of Hong Kong. Acquired present status and title 1994.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to May (September-December; January-May), Summer term, June-August
AdmissionRequirements: Meet general requirement, English and/or Chinese proficiency
Individual programmes may have additional entrance requirements
Consult university for details

Divisions.College: Electronic Packaging & Assemblies, Failure Analysis & Reliability Engineering (EPA Centre)
Innovative Applications of Internet and Multimedia Technologies (AIMtech Centre)
Smart Energy Conversion and Utilization Research (CSCR)
Hong Kong Advanced Institute for Cross-Disciplinary Studies
Social Media Marketing and Business Intelligence (CSMR)
State Key Laboratory in Marine Pollution (SKLMP)
State Key Laboratory of Millimeter Waves (SKLMW)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1956 as Hong Kong Baptist College, became autonomous 1983, and acquired present status and title 1994.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to June (September-January; January-June). MBA programme: September to May
AdmissionRequirements: Either Hong Kong Certificate of Education Examination (HKCEE), with Grade E/Level 2 or above in 6 subjects including Chinese Language (or French or German) and English Language with at least 5 subjects in a single sitting; and Hong Kong Advanced Level Examination (HKALE), with Grade E or above in Advanced Supplementary ('AS') subjects of Chinese Language and Culture, and use of English and either 2 advanced Level (AL) subjects or 1 AL subject plus 2 AS subjects obtainable in any two sittings or an acceptable equivalent qualification

Under the new 4-year education system from 2012, the general entrance requirements for applicants with Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) would be: Level 3 for English Language and Chinese Language, and Level 2 for Mathematics, Liberal Studies and One Elective subject
Some programmes have specific minimum entrance requirements, or additions to the above General Entrance Requirements

Divisions.College: Nonlinear and Complex Systems (Beijing-Hong Kong-Singapore Joint Centre)
Research and Development Division - School of Chinese Medicine
Advancing Translational Medicine in Bone & Joint Diseases
Sino-Humanitas (Mr. Simon Suen and Mrs. Mary Suen )
Applied Mathematics (Peking University-HKBU Joint Research Institute)
Cancer and Inflammation Research (Shum Yiu Foon Shum Bik Chuen Memorial Centre)
HKBU-UIC Joint Institute of Research Studies
Pearl River Delta Environment (Sino-Forest Applied Research Centre)
Physical Recreation and Wellness Research (Dr Stephen Hui)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1989 as Open Learning Institute of Hong Kong, became the The Open University of Hong Kong, a self-accrediting institution in1997, and acquired current title in 2021.
AdmissionRequirements: For undergraduate programmes, students should hold the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education or equivalent
For postgraduate programmes, students should have an undergraduate degree

Address.college_name: Hong Kong Nang Yan College of Higher Education

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969 as Hong Kong Buddhist College (HKBC). In April 2014, HKBC was approved by the HKSAR Government to become Hong Kong Nang Yan College of Higher Education to award university-level 4-year full-time Degrees.

Address.Street:
10 Wai Tsui Crescent
Braemar Hill Road

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1971 as Hong Kong Shue Yan College. Acquired current title and status 2006. Hong Kong's first private university.
AdmissionRequirements: Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (or equivalent) in at least six subjects, including English and Chinese

Divisions.College: Advanced Study in Dynamic Cooperative Games  (SRS Consortium)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1967. A degree-conferring tertiary institution fully funded by Hong Kong Government through the University Grants Committee. Acquired present status and title 1999.

Divisions.College: Hong Kong and South China Historical Research
Kwan Fong Cultural Research and Development
Hong Kong Institute of Business Studies

Address.college_name: The Chinese University of Hong Kong

GeneralInformation.History: CUHK is a highly esteemed, forward-looking comprehensive research university, recognized for excellence both regionally and globally. Founded in 1963, it is the second oldest university in Hong Kong. What sets CUHK apart are its deep roots in Chinese culture, its emphasis on bilingualism and multiculturalism, and a unique college system. The University’s founding philosophy is to combine tradition with modernity and to bring together China and the West
AdmissionRequirements:
For Undergraduate Programmes
(1) Local students: Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) examination results
(2) ) International students: GCE AL/ International AL, International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma, and other high school qualifications (e
g

high school diploma plus SAT / ACT and AP Tests / SAT Subject Tests in the USA, UEC/STPM in Malaysia, ATAR in Australia, OSSD/BC diploma in Canada, AISSCE (CBSE)/ ISC in India, SMA in Indonesia, etc) would be considered
(3) Students from mainland China: apply through the National Colleges and Universities Enrolment System - Details of admission requirements: https://admission
cuhk
edu

hk

For Postgraduate Programmes
(1) For Postgraduate Diploma Programmes: a Bachelor's degree from a recognized university
(2) For MPhil-PhD and Master's Programmes: a Bachelor's degree from a recognized university, with Second Class honours or above; or a Bachelor's degree from an honours programme of a recognized university, with an average grade of "B" or above
(3) For PhD, Doctor of Music and Taught Doctoral Programmes: a Master's degree from a recognized university - Details of admission requirements: https://www
gs
cuhk
edu
hk/admissions

Address.college_name: The Hang Seng University of Hong Kong

GeneralInformation.History: The Hang Seng University of Hong Kong, formerly known as Hang Seng Management College and Hang Seng School of Commerce, was created in 2010. It officially became a private university with the approval from Hong Kong SAR Government in October 2018
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to May (September-December; January-May), Summer term, June-August

Address.college_name: The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1984. Provides professional education, training and research, reflecting the cultural diversity of Hong Kong.
AdmissionRequirements: Undergraduate: 5 subject passes, including English and Chinese, in the Hong Kong Certificate of Education Examination (HKCEE), and a Diploma awarded by the Academy
Equivalent certificates are also considered
Master's programmes: Bachelor's Degree in relevant discipline with requisite marks

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1937. Became Hong Kong Technical College in 1947 and then Hong Kong Polytechnic in 1972. Acquired present status and title in 1994.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to May (September-December; January-May). Summer Term: May to August
AdmissionRequirements: Local Student, Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE); Non local student, an academic level equivalent to GCE A level standard, or International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma

Address.college_name: The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1988, and opened October 1991 as a technological university devoted to the advancement of learning and scholarship, with special emphasis on research, postgraduate education, and close collaboration with business and industry.
AdmissionRequirements: Hong Kong Certificate of Education (HKCEE) and Hong Kong Advanced Level Examination (HKALE), or equivalent
